document.forum_title: Latest World News on One News Page
document.discussion_title: Philippines drug war deaths double to 1,800
document.topic_text: Philippines drug war deaths double to 1,800 Monday, 22 August 2016 ( 31 minutes ago ) MANILA - The number of drug-related killings since President Rodrigo Duterte took power and declared war on drugs in May has doubled to about 1,800, police said on Monday, a day after Mr Duterte lashed out over United Nations criticism of the wave of deaths. Philippines' President Threatens to Leave the U.N. 00:55 Philippines drug war sparks outrage, fear (CNN)Filipino President Rodrigo Duterte has threatened to leave the United Nations in response to criticism of his approach to drug crime since taking office. The pugnacious new leader made the comments in a speech Sunday in Davao City, the southern Filipino...
